intro: Ammocodon, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Ammocodon has a compact growth habit with narrow, gray-green leaves. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
